Text: RE TNRCC State Summary FileMr Taylor I can get that information for you I am having some temporary trouble with the PSDB database that should be resolved by Thursday of this week I will look for how historical the data is for the State Summary File I have been keeping some of the files since I will be able to give you this answer tomorrow morning because I am scheduled to leave for the day about minutes ago Jim Parks Taylor Michael E MichaelE NRONcom PM Jim I wanted to know how I would find this data I am looking for the NOx emissions for the accounts below for I have some of the data for and very little for How do I find the rest of the data Website Database I believe you sent me the state database in August which included some and numbers for the accounts below I suppose some more accounts may have been updated for ACCOUNT HGV HGQ GBL GBQ HGV HGS MQF HGQ HGM HGH MQJ HGB HGL FGV GBT CID HGW BLR BLM Sincerely Michael Taylor Enron Global Markets Original Message From Jim Parks mailto Sent Thursday August PM To Taylor Michael E Subject RE TNRCC State Summary File Mr Taylor The allowable data is generally unique to each permit Because of this a general statement like the allowable tonsyear for SO in Harris County is would not be defendable or valid I believe that the allowable data varies in relation to the season of year and part of the state aka ambient background threshold In other words if it is ozone season allowable emissions probably would be lower The allowable emissions threshold is also variable over time years ago Harris county probably did not need an allowable cap for certain emissions As industry grows the allowable emissions will be adjusted The period of time for the data to become outdated could be as little as month depending on when new allowables or new permits are initiated Texas charges corporations a tax for emissions over their allowable limit It is sort of a payasyougo plan Of course I am being very simplistic here but the point is still the same Your questions are excellent and I am giving you as specific an answer as possible I hope I am not being too pointed but to the data oriented person the previous points are important for data integrity Jim Parks Taylor Michael E MichaelE NRONcom PM Jim Could you please explain to me where these numbers would NOT be accurate I was warned that the data allowables would not be accurate because of certain reasons Can you please detail those reasons for me Michael Taylor Coal and Emissions Trading Enron Global Markets This email is the property of Enron Corp andor its relevant affiliate and may contain confidential and privileged material for the sole use of the intended recipient s Any review use distribution or disclosure by others is strictly prohibited If you RE TNRCC State Summary FileMr Taylor I attach the Excel v State Summary file This file is also in compressed selfextracting format Please follow the directions given in the first email about how to inflate the data file You will have greater success with this data file than the previous one without allowables Again please accept my apology for neglecting to send the correct data file Jim Parks PH FAX

RE TNRCC State Summary FileMr Taylor Q How often does this data get updated A I download the file every month around the th Q is this data from the year or what is the term A The data comes from the Emission Inventory Questionnaire EIQ submitted by each company that meets or exceeds the emissions tracking threshold established by the EPA TNRCC The EIQs are an annual report TNRCC is usually about year behind the current year in the QA process for data submitted At the present time the year data is being downloaded to the TNRCC Point Source Database PSDB which is the database used to obtain the State Summary File Please excuse my long winded answer FYI you might be interested in a data file called the Major Emissions file It is a listing of all companies in TX that meet or exceed specific emissions threshold tracking criteria This file is a subset of the State Summary file If you want to know more let me know Jim Parks PH FAX

RE TNRCC State Summary FileMr Taylor The allowable data is generally unique to each permit Because of this a general statement like the allowable tonsyear for SO in Harris County is would not be defendable or valid I believe that the allowable data varies in relation to the season of year and part of the state aka ambient background threshold In other words if it is ozone season allowable emissions probably would be lower The allowable emissions threshold is also variable over time years ago Harris county probably did not need an allowable cap for certain emissions As industry grows the allowable emissions will be adjusted The period of time for the data to become outdated could be as little as month depending on when new allowables or new permits are initiated Texas charges corporations a tax for emissions over their allowable limit It is sort of a payasyougo plan Of course I am being very simplistic here but the point is still the same Your questions are excellent and I am giving you as specific an answer as possible I hope I am not being too pointed but to the data oriented person the previous points are important for data integrity Jim Parks Taylor Michael E MichaelE NRONcom PM Jim Could you please explain to me where these numbers would NOT be accurate I was warned that the data allowables would not be accurate because of certain reasons Can you please detail those reasons for me Michael Taylor Coal and Emissions Trading Enron Global Markets This email is the property of Enron Corp andor its relevant affiliate and may contain confidential and Michael E Subject RE TNRCC State Summary File Mr Taylor The allowable data is generally unique to each permit Because of this a general statement like the allowable tonsyear for SO in Harris County is would not be defendable or valid I believe that the allowable data varies in relation to the season of year and part of the state aka ambient background threshold In other words if it is ozone season allowable emissions probably would be lower The allowable emissions threshold is also variable over time years ago Harris county probably did not need an allowable cap for certain emissions As industry grows the allowable emissions will be adjusted The period of time for the data to become outdated could be as little as month depending on when new allowables or new permits are initiated State Summary FileMr Taylor I attach files The WordPerfect definitionlayout sheet may be used for all the State Summary Files sent with this and subsequent files sent in this series The WordPerfect v ExtractWPD document may also be used with this and the subsequent emails sent EXTRACTWPD is a WordPerfect v document that describes the process of inflating a selfextracting compressed file The short version is to same the file to your hard disk Using Microsoft Windows Explorer go to that saved file and double click on the file to begin the selfinflating process STATESMWPD is a WordPerfect v document that may be used as a field layoutdefinition sheet for attachment STATSMEXE is a data file in Excel v compressed selfextracting format I will send more emails to you because the State Summary Files are rather large and I dont want to drag down our file server As I mentioned before you may use the attachments for the remaining emails I will send you the invoice as well as the data disks and supporting documents through the US Postal Service If you have any questions or need additional data you may contact me at the locations listed below Thank you for the opportunity to serve your data request Jim Parks PH FAX
